title: Indian Lassi Recipe
description: Learn what a lassi drink is with this basic recipe made with yogurt, cold water, sugar, and salt, served with lots of ice for a refreshing beverage.

for the popular Indian beverage. You can adjust the amount of yogurt or water for a thicker or thinner consistency. Garnish with fresh mint if desired. Submitted by Simmi G Updated on April 16, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 5 5 5 5 Prep Time: 15 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings ice cubes 1 ¾ cups plain yogurt 1 ½ cups ice water 6 cubes ice, crushed 2 teaspoons white sugar 1 pinch salt Directions Gather all ingredients. Brie Goldman / Food Styling: Addelyn Evans / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco Fill 6 tall glasses with ice cubes. Brie Goldman / Food Styling: Addelyn Evans / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco Place yogurt, ice water, crushed ice, sugar, and salt in a blender; blend until frothy. Brie Goldman / Food Styling: Addelyn Evans / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco Pour over ice cubes in the glasses to serve. Brie Goldman / Food Styling: Addelyn Evans / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco Recipe Tip You can substitute 1/2 teaspoon salt for the sugar for a savory lassi. I Made It Print 69 home cooks made it!
